2022 Jabra Ladies Open presented by Bitstamp
The Jabra Ladies Open is held annually at the Evian-les-Bains Resort in France, which attracts some of the best female golfers from around the globe.

The Jabra Ladies Open is a real talent spotlight and a great opportunity to watch some of the best up-and-coming female golfers in Europe compete. It's quickly establishing itself as one of the main events on the women's golf calendar. The 2022 edition has much at stake: from an increased prize pool to a qualification opportunity for two major tournaments.

As the presenting sponsor of this prestigious event, we're excited to help encourage and nurture the champions of tomorrow and we're proud to be able to help increase the prize pool to €250,000. We hope our contribution helps to make the Jabra Ladies Open an even more enjoyable and rewarding experience for everyone involved.

The Jabra Ladies Open is held annually at the Evian-les-Bains Resort in France, attracts some of the best female golfers from around the globe and it has free access for the public. This year's tournament will host 132 players from May 19 to 21, 2022 and as such is sure to be an exciting one, so don't miss your chance to catch all the action.

Slovenian ties with 2022 Jabra Ladies Open

Bitstamp and the reigning champion share the same roots - both come from Slovenia. This professional golf tournament is one of the many ways that Slovenia is punching above its weight and making a name for itself on the international stage. With its strong showing in both golf and crypto, Slovenia is quickly becoming a force to be reckoned with.

The reigning champion of the Jabra Ladies Open is Pia Babnik, a 17-year-old Slovenian golfer. Babnik made history at the Jabra Ladies Open last year, becoming the youngest winner ever on the Ladies European Tour.

And now, with Slovenian origins and as the longest-running crypto exchange, we're proud to sponsor the event and are committed to supporting up-and-coming athletes who are taking their game to the next level.

Bitstamp contributes to largest prize pool in tournament's history

The Jabra Ladies Open is a test of the best female golfers in the world, their talent and skill, and the winner takes home a considerable amount of money. As one of the most prestigious golf tournaments in Europe, it’s only suitable that this is reflected in its prize pool of €250,000; we’re proud that our contribution is making this year’s prize pool the largest in the history of the tournament, attracting the best female golfers in the world to France to compete for the title.

Tournament’s three-fold stake

The Jabra Ladies Open is more than just a chance to win a title on the European circuit. It's also an opportunity to qualify for two major tournaments: the Amundi Evian Championship (July 21-24, 2022) and the AIG Women's Open (August 4-7, 2022).

We’ll also be present at the Amundi Evian Championship with some of our clients for good company to enjoy the tournament. It should be a great opportunity to watch some of the best female golfers in the world compete for the total prize of $4,500,000.

Bitstamp’s Hole in One Reward

For this year’s Jabra Ladies Open, we’ve prepared an extra special reward for the golfer who manages to score a hole in one. We’re giving away €5,000 in bitcoin to the first player to achieve this feat.

If you're looking for a great event to watch some of the best up-and-coming female golfers in Europe compete, make sure to mark the Jabra Ladies Open on your calendar.
